intro: Baissea subrufa, commonly known as the red-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along its stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, followed by berries that are typically red or orange in color. Baissea subrufa relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides shelter and food for various insects and birds. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the ecosystems where it is found.
